meanings.definition: A person who blurts out information without thinking.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is known as one of the blurters in our class.
meanings.sent2: The blurters in the meeting revealed the surprise party plan.
meanings.sent3: The blurters accidentally spilled the secret about the surprise cake.
meanings.sent4: The blurters were like leaky faucets, unable to hold back any information.
meanings.sent5: The blurters were like walking megaphones, broadcasting every detail.

meanings.definition: The act of blurting out information without thinking.
meanings.sent1: Blurters can sometimes cause awkward moments in conversations.
meanings.sent2: Her blurters during the presentation revealed the upcoming project.
meanings.sent3: The blurters at the party made everyone laugh with their unexpected comments.
meanings.sent4: The blurters echoed through the room, catching everyone off guard.
meanings.sent5: The blurters were like fireworks, bursting out suddenly and brightly.
